channel.title: DevHawk tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from DevHawk.

item.description:
Like last time, I'll be spending a lot of my time during the Neo Polaris Launchpad Hackathon (https://t.co/nsdj4fXH09) helping participants and answering questions about @Neo_Blockchain development and the Neo Blockchain Toolkit. https://t.co/wvGWX7OclY
I love events like this. The direct line to the folks using the tools under the pressure of competition is invaluable. Feedback we got last time led directly to product improvements that benefit the entire community.
There are significant debugger improvements that will be available (in preview) this week. Neo C# tooling updates to support these debugger improvements will be available later this month - just in time for the start of the hackathon in April!
https://t.co/ZOyqOQYiyJ
If you're participating in Neo Polaris Launchpad, please don't hesitate to reach out to me with questions.
The best way to reach me is via the official @Neo_Blockchain Discord (https://t.co/wkxYs9CCV9), though you can obviously also reach me here on Twitter as well.
Good Luck!
My son didn't know the term "disc jockey" 不不不 #ImOld

Would have liked to see a @SeattleKraken win, but the @Capitals need the standings points more. My eldest said tonight was like the opposite of watching say a Penguins /Flyers game. Those games, we're usually rooting for a meteor to hit the arena.
Love to see @Capitals saluting @SeattleKraken captain Mark Giordano in his 1000th game

My wife and parents conspired to bring me back east to catch @SeattleKraken v. @Capitals. I've been a Caps fan since I was a kid. And of course I support the Kraken - my home team. So its awesome to get the chance to see these two teams face off. https://t.co/foLDc9WuM9
I figured there would be of plenty of folks in Caps jerseys, so I wore my Kraken jersey. Way out numbered, but I've seen more Seattle jerseys than I was expecting
@ZackCz Can we have Al Franken back in office?
@roschler I'm on vacation, I'm not hiding under a rock without access to the internet
Hey, I think I know that guy https://t.co/X1VvJTee6g
Good luck in your future endeavors @migueldeicaza https://t.co/8ePWxS8XTq

Is there a xplat .NET library for working with file system paths that I'm not aware of? I could roll my own, but I'd rather use an existing (i.e. tested) library. I've done enough file system work to know there be dragons in the edge cases.
